title: Marinara Sauce
tagline: Marcella Hazan's legendary 3-ingredient sauce. Simplicity perfected.
description: Marcella Hazan's legendary 3-ingredient sauce. Tomatoes, butter, onion. That's it. Serves 4.
steps: Put tomatoes (with their juice), butter, and onion halves in a saucepan.
Bring to a simmer over medium heat. Reduce heat to maintain a gentle, steady simmer.
Cook uncovered for 45 minutes, stirring occasionally and crushing tomatoes with a wooden spoon.
Taste and add more salt if needed.
Toss with hot pasta. Serve with fresh parmesan.
notes: BUTTER not olive oil: This is the whole point. Butter makes it silky and rich. Trust Marcella.
Onion stays whole: It flavors the sauce subtly without overpowering. Discard at the end.
Don't add garlic: Sounds wrong, but this sauce doesn't need it. The simplicity IS the flavor.
San Marzano tomatoes: Worth the extra dollar. Sweeter, less acidic.
Storage: Keeps 1 week refrigerated, freezes well for 3 months.
source: Marcella Hazan from Essentials of Classic Italian Cooking
